Some more details here would be appreciated.
Ack

I see this review is touching multiple features. Could you split this into seperate reviews one above the other?
May be 
1. terminus management
2. PDR handling
3. sensor handling
Is this an example of a real config for some machine? If the former, then this should go to the machine's meta layer.
The file is remvoed.
Why not match this to the spec? It's not clear which PDR this is from DSP0248.
The struct is removed.
Why has a lot of code been removed in this file b/w patchsets 4 and 19?
remove?
Ack
It looks like this patch is not properly rebased on top of the MCTP discovery one.
Ack
Please introduce all the sensor related code in commits that use/implement them.
Ack
nit: termini
Ack
Should not assume a single-part PDR response. The code is not asking for next parts.
Fixed
Please introduce these in commits that use them.
Ack
What about sensor and effecter names?
Fixed at https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/pldm/+/53961/4/platform-mc/terminus.cpp#39
I'm not following this. Why are we making inventory items here? That should be based on FRU.

The inventoryPath is needed by the creating association interface for sensor D-Bus object for exposing PLDM sensor to Redfish. https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/architecture/sensor-architecture.md

The inventoryPath will be passed to sensor class for creating its association interface at https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/pldm/+/51489/4/platform-mc/terminus.cpp#384
Introduce in commit that implements this.
Ack
Please add doxygen-style documentation.
Ack

I think we should map this code to the discovery agent and initialization agent steps, as defined in dsp-248. I don't think this is performing all the discovery/initialization steps. That either needs to be implemented in this commit or documented in the commit message if certain steps are not being implemented.
commit message is updated
Can this be std::moved?
The code is removed in new patch set.
Seems odd to stop this at discovery...
The code is removed in new patch set.
What about fetching the terminus locator PDR? The initialization agent is supposed to do that, based on dsp0248.
The code is removed in new patch set.
Don't we need to check if the terminus supports Type 0, Type 2 and the necessary commands?
Fixed in new patch set.
You don't seem to be calling sacnTerminus() again in the else (success) case. How would processing of other termini, if present, continue?
The code is re-implemented in new patch set.
Please init locals.
Ack
What about success cases?
The code is re-implemented in new patch set.
Avoid magic numbers.
Ack
Ok to do this if assignedTid is 0?
Ack
SetTID is an optional command. How do deal with termini that support PLDM Type 2 but not SetTID.
Ack
We probably need a better/elegant way to continue the scanning process. I know you've made it async, but this could be error prone if it's missed to be called somewhere.
re-implemented by using Coroutine
I see - here's where we continue rescan for the success cases? It would be good to find a way to just call scanTerminus() from one spot.
fixed re-implemented
No error handling needed here?
fixed by re-implemented
This may have to be configurable.
Ack
Not following this. How does a value of 0 tell us this is the right entry to assign the EID to?
Ack
Please check if you need to include all of these headers here.
Ack
nit: termini
Ack
No magic numbers please.
Ack
Please add documentation for all APIs.
Ack
Document all these as well please.
Ack
I think we'd need add a lot more unit tests to cover negative paths.
Ack
What if there are static MCTP endpoints? Also it seems like this should be contained in the MCTP discovery class?
fixed by the patch set https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/pldm/+/51184/19/requester/mctp_endpoint_discovery.cpp#81

These code are used for support SetTID PLDM command.
What do you think if we move it to new patches.

How is that to create a new patch set like below?

platform-mc: Sensor handling
platform-mc: PDR handling
platform-mc: Added TerminusManager and Terminus class
(new)libpldm: Added support of SetTID command
requester: Added support to send/recv PLDM message by coroutine
requester: Modified MctpDiscovery class
Ack
I think you can move these code to different patch. Which can call as support coroutine_handle.

How is that to create a new patch set like below?

platform-mc: Sensor handling
platform-mc: PDR handling
platform-mc: Added TerminusManager and Terminus class
(new)requester: Added support to send/recv PLDM message by coroutine
requester: Modified MctpDiscovery class
Ack
What's the plan to support TL PDR?
Mostly looks good to me (I didn't look at the coroutine usage in detail since there are comments on that in a previous patch). Have few comments.
Could you define a using directive (or use existing one if present) for TID?
Ack
Is there a reason for this to be public?
TerminusManager needs to access pdrs to append received pdr from terminus.
Can you use an existing bitfield union defined in pldm_types.h?
Ack
How do you get 1024? Please avoid magic mumbers.
It is from buffer size and it is changed to recvBufSize for better meaning in new patch set.
Why is this change needed?

This is for pldmd to be able to export D-Bus object at other path than "/xyz/openbmc_project/software/*".
e.g. the D-Bus object for inventory interface at "/xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/*"
We need to see the tradeoff to see if two separate object managers or a single object manager.
UpperCamelCase + TID should suffice
The Terminus is shared where else?
Terminus will be accessed by TerminusManager and SensorManager in following patch set
Does this work https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/utility/bitset/test>?
Ack
nit: In OpenBMC we don't use _ for class variables
Ack
Based on GetPLDMTypes we should invoking platform and firmware update discovery.
The reference parameters of a coroutine could become dangling if the coroutine is resumed after the lifetime of referred object ends
New patch set changes to pass by value and queue the mctpInfos for the case that previous task is still in progress.
Done
Just 'tid' should suffice. It is known that TID is a PLDM identifier, so PLDM prefix will not give any additional info. https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/cpp-style-and-conventions.md#types
Ack
MCTP_EID_NULL ?
The name of definition is referred to the table 2 of DSP0236 v1.3.1. It defines that EID=0 is a Null destination/Source EID.
Yes, NULL EID is MCTP specific not PLDM. so, adding PLDM prefix is kind of confusing. But I suppose the PLDM prefix is added since it is part of libpldm.
The define is removed since new pushed patch set implements TID pool doesn't need  it now.
Does this mean that when PLDM supports other transport layer, it should have an equivalent class preforming these functions?

The new patch set reserved the flexibility to support other transport layer.
The idea is to define new XXXDiscoveryHandlerIntf(e.g XXX=NCSI) and then implemented the interface APIs.
Ack

How are we planning to handle when we support multiple MCTP networks? Duplicate EIDs are possible in that case. It will be better if we can have some directions to avoid future redesigns.

As per specification TIDs should be unique but not EID. So we can have a map with terminus as key 
```
std::map<std::shared_ptr<Terminus>, 
     mctp_eid_t /* or MctpInfo or TransportIdentifier */> termini{};
```

OR
we can have something like
```
std::map <MctpInfo, std::shared_ptr<Terminus>> termini{}
```
Where MctpInfo can have EID, UUID/NetworkID

For supporting other transport layer, the map key is changed to use tid.
The NetworkID is included in MctpInfo.
The toMctpInfo() can lookup terminus's MctpInfo by tid.
Ack

Are we not planning to use libpldm provided pdr?
https://github.com/openbmc/pldm/blob/master/libpldm/pdr.c#L16

I know current libpldm implementation of PDR primarily concentrate on responder usecase. But two major things which i was able to leverage from it in Intel implementation was PDR repository storage mechanism and APIs for managing/creating entity association tree from PDR data.

The terminus manager is directly coupled with mctp EID since Terminus manager is mainly for handling PLDM endpoints, shall we refer all the places by TID alone and remove EID references. we may need to get the EID only at the time of sending the PLDM request. at this point we can use the TIDPool( which keeps the 
TID-to-EID map) to get the EID .
getting the EID from TID could be part of the request/handler class rather than inside terminus manager.
The same TIDPool map can be used to keep the TID to transport endpoint ID( for example, transport endpoint id can be eid for MCTP and EBT UUID for NCSI over RBT ) 
If we are looking forward supporting other transport this changes will make it easy to adapt other transport layers w.r.t the following design.
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/docs/+/47519
Ack
Note:- This logic will not work in multi-network MCTP. We always need to work with MctpInfo not just EID.
The argument is changed to MctpInfo and the function checkes networkId in new patch set.
Done

This is the map which creates TID to transport specific endpoint ID(mctp eid or RBT UUID) map.
can we make it to accept generic type name like size_t so that it look common for any transport layer Endpoint.

mapToTid() is updated to take MctpInfo tuple to support multiple MCTP network.
To support other transport layer can overload mapToTid() to take transport specific parameter.

should this be named as discover MCTP based terminus discoverMctpTerminusTask() so that other transport layer(ncsi) based Terminus discovery  can be added separately.
These methods can be used part of the pldm endpoint discovery process using method
discoverMctpTerminusTask() similarly discoverNCSIRBTTerminusTask() can be added.
both methods discovers PLDM endpoints available over these transport layers
and final TID list is added part of the same TIDPool map.(TID to EID or TID to RBT UUID)
After this point terminus manager can only refer TIDs and at the time of
sending the PLDM request (SendRecvPldmMsg) using the TIDPoolMap we can get the respective transport layer endpoint IDs.
Ack
In case setTID is not supported(device having some static TID), we should atleast reserve the TID reported in getTID in our TID pool so that we will not use it for another device.
Ack
Any plan to suport GetPDRRepositoryInfo command? It is a mandatory command in M&C to verify repositoryState and other details before issuing getPDR command.
Working on it. will be implemented in next version of patch set.
It is implemented in new patch set.

The getTID and setTID are used part of PLDM terminus discovery part.at this point we might not have created the TIDPool map which we have discussed in the other comment.should we rename these methods to setTIDOverMCTP() and getTIDOverMCTP() as it only sets/gets TID for mctp based pldm endpoint.
Ack

The terminus manager being a PLDM terminus manager,I think  MCTP EID association is not needed until this point which is SendRecvPldmMsg function.
so up to this point we can refer the PLDM endpoints solely based on TID reference itself. the requester/handler part of PLDM service can use the TID_to_EID map (tidPool)to get the EID from the TID right before sending the PLDM message.

MCTP EID association is needed for PLDM encode request message API() too.
Since instanceId is part of PLDM message header and generating instanceId is managed by https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/blob/master/yaml/xyz/openbmc_project/PLDM/Requester.interface.yaml.
According to the description of Requester.interface, EID is used for input argument to generate instanceId.
The terminusManager implemented its SendRecvPldmMsg() which takes TID now.
Do we need a null check here before accessing value?
Ack
In this case let's clear terminus->pdrs to make sure we are starting fresh. It helps in case we want to fetch the PDR again using this function.
Ack
We might need a le16toh() conversation here.
Ack

We can't neglect the possibility of faulty PLDM devices(add in cards) which never returns nextDataTransferHndl as 0. If that happens we will end up in an infinite while loop. 

I would suggest to have a limit on multipart transfer as a fail safe.
Or you can support getPDRRepositoryInfo command and use largestRecordSize value to cross verify that you are not fetching any record whose size exceeds that value.
Ack

Similar possibility of infinite while loop here as well.

Here you can use recordCount from GetPDRRepositoryInfo command as the fail safe.
Ack

From what i see, this class manages TID assignment flow. Which is common for all PLDM types. I would recommend to keep it generic so that other PLDM types also can make use of it and work with TID.

If we can exclude PDR related APIs out of this class, it should suffice.

Also, in future when we like to support other transport layers like NCSI, we can extend the same class for TID assignment.
The PDR related APIs are move to platform_manager.hpp/cpp
data?
Ack

The variable should be initialized.
Without initialization, the patch set is failed to start discovery the termini in Ampere system.

In the AddInterface callback, mctpInfos will only have the list of new MCTP termini "removing the absent terminus" can cause the discovered termini will be removed.
The code changing in mctp_endpoint_discovery.cpp/hpp should be updated to always send list available MCTP EID to discoverMctpTerminus()
